dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 406 IH: Promote Restoring Order To End Campus Targeting of Jewish Students and Faculty Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Yakym (for himself and Ms. Scholten) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions of higher education, as a condition of participation in programs under title IV of such Act, to include a prohibition of antisemitic conduct in all documents relating to student or employee conduct.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promote Restoring Order To End Campus Targeting of Jewish Students and Faculty Act or the PROTECT Jewish Student and Faculty Act.
Section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1094(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The institution will include, in all documents and other resources relating to student or employee conduct on campus—

subparagraph.text: a definition of antisemitism which states that—

clause.text: antisemitism is a certain perception of Jews, which may be expressed as hatred toward Jews; and
rhetorical and physical manifestations of antisemitism may be directed toward—

subclause.text: Jewish or non-Jewish individuals, including the property of such individuals; and
Jewish community institutions and religious facilities; and

subparagraph.text: a statement that antisemitic conduct is prohibited on campus, and that such conduct—

clause.text: by a student may result in the expulsion of the student from the institution; and
by an employee may result in the termination of the employee’s employment at the institution.
